---
example:
  title: Rewrite multiple DOM elements (2)
  instructions: |
    Rewrite the `<binary>` tags on this page as `<select class="form-control">`
    tags. Convert the child tags of the `<binary>` tag to `<option>` tags, with
    classes matching the name of the original tag.

    ```html
    <select class="form-control">
      <option></option>
      <option class="true">right</option>
      <option class="false">wrong</option>
    </select>
    ```
  hint: |
    Add en event listener that adds the `is-correct` or `is-wrong` class when
    the user selects the correct or incorrect answer.
  solution:
    js: |
      const binary = [...document.getElementsByTagName('binary')]

      function rewriteBinary (binary) {
        let select = document.createElement('select')
        select.className = 'form-control'
        select.appendChild(document.createElement('option'))
        for (let opt of binary.children) {
          let option = document.createElement('option')
          option.className = opt.tagName.toLowerCase()
          option.textContent = opt.textContent
          select.appendChild(option)
        }
        return select
      }

      console.log(binary)

      for (let el of binary) {
        console.log(el)
        el.replaceWith(rewriteBinary(el))
      }
    css: |-
      .is-correct {
          border: 2px solid green;
      }
      .is-wrong {
          border: 2px solid red;
      }
output: js4shiny::html_document_plain
